top_categories.workout_context: 53ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Hell of Hunterdon. Train it until it feels boring.
At Hell of Hunterdon, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Hell of Hunterdon's New Jersey rolling hills, Rural gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 75 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Hell of Hunterdon's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
75 miles on New Jersey rolling hills gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
When someone attacks on New Jersey rolling hills gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Varied gradients on New Jersey rolling hills gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Hell of Hunterdon, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 4,000ft of climbing on New Jersey rolling hills gravel does to your power file on race day.
76–85% FTP for extended efforts. At Hell of Hunterdon, tempo is the floor you'll live on. Make it feel easy.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Hell of Hunterdon’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Hell of Hunterdon requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on new jersey rolling hills gravel to build confidence. Expect: new jersey rolling hills, rural gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, G Spot, and Over Under to prepare you for 75 miles of new jersey rolling hills gravel in Hunterdon County, New Jersey.
